title: Point Reyes National Seashore: 2016 Archives
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     Park Wavelengths     2016 Archives                Park Wavelengths - 2016       RSS  About This Blog Park Wavelengths was a bi-weekly email published from 2003 until mid-2016 informing subscribers about events, closures, natural history, and cultural history at Point Reyes.   Park Wavelengths - Wednesday, July 6, 2016  July 06, 2016 Posted by: Loretta Farley    News release about closure of the Cross Marin Trail from early August through October to replace a failed corrugated metal pipe culvert. Point Reyes, Point Reyes National Seashore, Cross Marin Trail, Marin Municipal Water District, MMWD, fish      Park Wavelengths - Friday, July 1, 2016  July 01, 2016 Posted by: Loretta Farley    Tips for the holiday weekend; the Bear Valley and Lighthouse visitor centers are open throughout the weekend, including on Monday; all camping permits have been reserved for Saturday and Sunday nights; updates on wildlife protection closures; no fireworks permitted. Point Reyes, Point Reyes National Seashore, Park Wavelengths, harbor seal, harbor seals, snowy plover, snowy plovers, western snowy plover, western snowy plovers, temporary closure, closure, beach closure, backcountry camping      Park Wavelengths - Wednesday, May 25, 2016  May 25, 2016 Posted by: Loretta Farley    Extreme low and high tides in early June; elderberries and blackberries; great blue herons hunting gophers; rattlesnake grass; goats are back at D Ranch; information about Memorial Day weekend; Memorial Day service at the U.S. Life-Saving Service cemetery; part of the Point Reyes Beach is closed on weekends and federal holidays to better protect nesting snowy plovers. Point Reyes, Point Reyes National Seashore, Park Wavelengths, goats, U.S. Life-Saving Service, USLSS, Memorial Day, snowy plover, snowy plovers, western snowy plover, Charadrius nivosus, Charadrius nivosus nivosus, closure, beach closure, motor lifeboat      Park Wavelengths - Monday, May 9, 2016  May 09, 2016 Posted by: Loretta Farley    The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is considering developing future rulemaking to allow U.S. Coast Guard discharges within part or all of Greater Farallones and Cordell Bank National Marine Sanctuaries and invites the public to weigh in on these issues. Point Reyes, Point Reyes National Seashore, Park Wavelengths, NOAA, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, USCG, U.S. Coast Guard, regulations.gov, Cordell Bank National Marine Sanctuary, Greater Farallones National Marine Sanctuary      Park Wavelengths - Friday, May 6, 2016  May 06, 2016 Posted by: Loretta Farley    Eta Aquarid meteor shower; transit of Mercury; fire season begins; exclosures have been installed on the Great Beach to better protect nesting snowy plovers; California Coastal Commission Art and Poetry contest artwork and poems are on display at the Bear Valley Visitor Center. Applications must be postmarked on or before April 29.
